Table5.Title: When CA had less than 2 million people vaccinated in HPI quartile 1
Table5.Description: The case rate, test positivity, and health equity metric thresholds must be met to move forward toward more reopening.
Table5.Footnote: If both the test positivity and health equity metric are especially low, and the case rate is declining but does not yet meet less restrictive tier’s level, a county can still move forward towards more reopening. See rules on accelerated progression.

Table5.Title: Because CA has 2 million people vaccinated in HPI quartile 1
Table5.Description: The case rate, test positivity, and health equity metric thresholds must be met to move forward toward more reopening.
Table5.Footnote: If both the test positivity and health equity metric are especially low, and the case rate is declining but does not yet meet less restrictive tier’s level, a county can still move forward towards more reopening. See rules on accelerated progression.

Table5.Title: When CA has 4 million people vaccinated in HPI quartile 1
Table5.Description: The case rate, test positivity, and health equity metric thresholds must be met to move forward toward more reopening.
